channel.title: üè¢ College of Intelligence and Computing, Tianjin University on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ College of Intelligence and Computing, Tianjin University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Conditional Controllable Image Fusion
item.description: Conditional Controllable Fusion (CCF) achieves training-free, adaptable image fusion by dynamically injecting fusion conditions into a pre-trained denoising diffusion model.

item.title: Deep Correlated Prompting for Visual Recognition with Missing Modalities
item.description: Deep Correlated Prompting enhances large multimodal models’ robustness against missing data by leveraging inter-layer and cross-modality correlations in prompts, achieving superior performance with mi…

item.title: IRCAN: Mitigating Knowledge Conflicts in LLM Generation via Identifying and Reweighting Context-Aware Neurons
item.description: IRCAN tackles LLM knowledge conflicts by identifying and reweighting context-aware neurons, significantly improving context-sensitive outputs.

item.title: Out-Of-Distribution Detection with Diversification (Provably)
item.description: Boost OOD detection accuracy with diverseMix: a novel method enhancing auxiliary outlier diversity, provably improving generalization and achieving state-of-the-art results.

item.title: PERIA: Perceive, Reason, Imagine, Act via Holistic Language and Vision Planning for Manipulation
item.description: PERIA: Holistic language & vision planning for complex robotic manipulation!

item.title: Single Image Reflection Separation via Dual-Stream Interactive Transformers
item.description: Dual-Stream Interactive Transformers (DSIT) revolutionizes single image reflection separation by using a novel dual-attention mechanism that captures inter- and intra-layer correlations, significantly…

item.title: The Ladder in Chaos: Improving Policy Learning by Harnessing the Parameter Evolving Path in A Low-dimensional Space
item.description: Deep RL policy learning is improved by identifying and boosting key parameter update directions using a novel temporal SVD analysis, leading to more efficient and effective learning.

item.title: What Matters in Graph Class Incremental Learning? An Information Preservation Perspective
item.description: GSIP framework mitigates catastrophic forgetting in graph class incremental learning by preserving crucial graph information, achieving a 10% improvement in forgetting metrics.
